description: High-protein muscle building plan with optimal 30P/40C/30F macros

meal_prep_session.covers: 10 meal prep recipes that save you time throughout the week
meal_prep_session.focus: Batch-cook proteins and grains for easy weekday meals

instructions: MARINADE: Mix lemon juice, olive oil, oregano, garlic, salt and pepper
CHICKEN: Marinate chicken 30min+, then bake at 375°F for 25-30 minutes to 165°F internal
RICE: Cook rice with chicken broth and a squeeze of lemon for Mediterranean flavor
VEGETABLES: Roast tomatoes and bell peppers at 400°F for 20 minutes until caramelized
ASSEMBLY: Slice chicken, portion rice, add roasted vegetables, fresh cucumber, olives, and feta
STORAGE: Keeps 3-4 days fresh, freeze portions up to 3 months
PREP PACKS: Portion berries, banana, spinach into 4 freezer bags
FREEZE: Store smoothie packs in freezer for up to 3 months
BLEND: Add protein powder and liquid when ready to drink
SERVE: Blend until smooth, add liquid as needed for consistency
STORAGE: Pre-portioned frozen packs, just add protein and blend
PORTION YOGURT: Divide Greek yogurt into 3 containers
PREP TOPPINGS: Wash berries, portion nuts into small bags
ASSEMBLY: Keep toppings separate until serving
SERVE: Add berries and nuts just before eating
STORAGE: Yogurt keeps 5-7 days, assemble fresh daily
WASH: Clean apples thoroughly under cold water
PORTION: Pre-portion peanut butter into small containers
SLICE: Cut apples just before eating to prevent browning
SERVE: Dip apple slices in peanut butter
STORAGE: Whole apples keep 1 week, slice fresh daily
PORTION: Divide nuts into 3 small containers or bags
STORE: Keep in airtight containers at room temperature
SERVE: Perfect grab-and-go snack
STORAGE: Keeps fresh for 2-3 weeks in sealed containers
MIX DRY: Combine oat flour, protein powder, baking powder
MIX WET: Whisk eggs, Greek yogurt, and milk
COMBINE: Mix wet and dry ingredients until just combined
COOK: Pour batter on griddle, cook 2-3 minutes per side
STORAGE: Freeze cooked pancakes up to 3 months, reheat in toaster
SWEET POTATO: Cube and roast at 400°F for 25-30 minutes
BEEF: Brown ground beef with onions and seasonings
RICE: Cook brown rice separately
ASSEMBLY: Layer rice, beef, sweet potato, and black beans
STORAGE: Keeps 3-4 days refrigerated, freeze up to 3 months
QUINOA: Cook quinoa with vegetable broth
SALMON: Season and bake at 400°F for 12-15 minutes
VEGETABLES: Steam or roast asparagus until tender
ASSEMBLY: Plate quinoa, top with salmon and vegetables
STORAGE: Best fresh, but keeps 2-3 days refrigerated

ingredients.notes: Use whites only, save yolks for other recipes

instructions: PREP EGGS: Separate egg whites from yolks
VEGETABLES: Sauté bell pepper and spinach until tender
SCRAMBLE: Add egg whites, scramble until fluffy
SEASON: Add salt, pepper, and herbs to taste
STORAGE: Best made fresh, but can prep vegetables ahead
FREEZE BANANAS: Slice and freeze bananas ahead of time
BLEND: Combine frozen bananas, protein powder, and almond milk
PROCESS: Blend until smooth and creamy like ice cream
SERVE: Eat immediately for soft-serve texture
STORAGE: Can refreeze for firmer texture

ingredients.notes: For Mediterranean bowls - used 5x throughout week
For power bowls - Tuesday & Saturday dinners
For quinoa plates - Thursday & Sunday dinners
Cherry tomatoes, bell peppers, cucumber, red onion
Olive oil, lemons, oregano, garlic, feta, olives

equipment_needed: Medium pots for rice and quinoa
instructions: MARINADE PREP (10 min): Make Mediterranean marinade with lemon, olive oil, oregano, garlic
MARINATE CHICKEN (30 min): Season chicken with marinade while you prep other ingredients
START GRAINS (5 min): Begin brown rice and quinoa in separate pots - cook with lemon for flavor
ROAST VEGETABLES (25 min): Cherry tomatoes, bell peppers, and sweet potatoes at 400°F
COOK PROTEINS (35 min): Bake marinated chicken, brown ground beef in skillet
COOL AND PORTION (45 min): Let everything cool, slice proteins, assemble Mediterranean bowls
STORAGE OPTIONS: Choose freeze strategy (5 bowls at once) OR mini-prep strategy (3 + 2)
FRESH COMPONENTS: Keep feta, cucumber, and olives separate for freshest taste

storage_guidelines.freeze_strategy: Mediterranean bowls: 3 days fresh + 2 freeze well for 3 months. Thaw 24hrs before eating.
storage_guidelines.mini_prep_strategy: Make 3 bowls Sunday, 2 more Wednesday. Always fresh, 3-4 days max.
storage_guidelines.fresh_components: Store feta, cucumber, olives separately. Add after reheating.
storage_guidelines.food_safety: Never leave at room temp >2hrs. Reheat to 165°F internal temperature.

instructions: MARINADE: Mix lemon juice, olive oil, oregano, garlic, salt and pepper
CHICKEN: Marinate chicken 30min+, then bake at 375°F for 25-30 minutes to 165°F internal
RICE: Cook rice with chicken broth and a squeeze of lemon for Mediterranean flavor
VEGETABLES: Roast tomatoes and bell peppers at 400°F for 20 minutes until caramelized
ASSEMBLY: Slice chicken, portion rice, add roasted vegetables, fresh cucumber, olives, and feta
STORAGE: See storage options below for 3-day fresh vs freeze strategy

option_a_freeze.title: Freeze Strategy (One Big Prep)
instructions: Make all 5 bowls on prep day
Store 3 bowls in fridge (use Days 1-3)
Store 2 bowls in freezer immediately
Thaw frozen bowls in fridge 24hrs before eating
Add fresh feta and cucumber after reheating
option_a_freeze.pros: One prep session, done for the week
option_a_freeze.food_safety: Safe for 3 days fresh, 3 months frozen

option_b_mini_prep.title: Mini-Prep Strategy (Always Fresh)
instructions: Sunday: Make 3 bowls for Mon-Wed
Wednesday: Quick 15-min prep for 2 more bowls (Thu-Fri)
All bowls stay fresh in fridge
Reheat and add fresh feta/cucumber daily
option_b_mini_prep.pros: Always eating fresh, no freezer space needed

prep_meals.meal_prep_notes: Mediterranean flavors make this much more exciting than plain chicken & rice. Choose storage method based on your schedule!

instructions: Cube sweet potatoes and roast at 400°F for 20-25 minutes
Brown ground beef with seasonings
Sauté bell peppers until tender
Combine in bowls with sweet potatoes as base
prep_meals.meal_prep_notes: High-protein, complex carbs perfect for muscle growth.

instructions: Cook quinoa with vegetable broth for 15 minutes
Pan-sear salmon 4-5 minutes per side until flaky
Steam asparagus until crisp-tender
Portion quinoa, salmon, and asparagus into containers
prep_meals.meal_prep_notes: Omega-3 rich salmon with complete protein quinoa.

meal_prep_session.covers: 10 meal prep recipes that save you time throughout the week
meal_prep_session.focus: Batch-cook proteins and grains for easy weekday meals

instructions: MARINADE: Mix lemon juice, olive oil, oregano, garlic, salt and pepper
CHICKEN: Marinate chicken 30min+, then bake at 375°F for 25-30 minutes to 165°F internal
RICE: Cook rice with chicken broth and a squeeze of lemon for Mediterranean flavor
VEGETABLES: Roast tomatoes and bell peppers at 400°F for 20 minutes until caramelized
ASSEMBLY: Slice chicken, portion rice, add roasted vegetables, fresh cucumber, olives, and feta
STORAGE: See storage options below for 3-day fresh vs freeze strategy
SWEET POTATO: Cube and roast at 400°F for 25-30 minutes
BEEF: Brown ground beef with onions and seasonings
RICE: Cook brown rice separately
ASSEMBLY: Layer rice, beef, sweet potato, and black beans
STORAGE: Keeps 3-4 days refrigerated, freeze up to 3 months
QUINOA: Cook quinoa with vegetable broth
SALMON: Season and bake at 400°F for 12-15 minutes
VEGETABLES: Steam or roast asparagus until tender
ASSEMBLY: Plate quinoa, top with salmon and vegetables
STORAGE: Best fresh, but keeps 2-3 days refrigerated
MIX DRY: Combine oat flour, protein powder, baking powder
MIX WET: Whisk eggs, Greek yogurt, and milk
COMBINE: Mix wet and dry ingredients until just combined
COOK: Pour batter on griddle, cook 2-3 minutes per side
STORAGE: Freeze cooked pancakes up to 3 months, reheat in toaster
PREP JARS: Mix oats, protein powder, chia seeds in 7 jars
ADD LIQUID: Pour milk into each jar, stir well
REFRIGERATE: Let sit overnight, minimum 4 hours
SERVE: Add fresh fruit and nuts before eating
STORAGE: Keeps 5 days refrigerated, prep Sunday for the week
PREP FRUIT: Slice bananas, portion berries into freezer bags
ADD GREENS: Add spinach to each bag
FREEZE: Store in freezer for up to 3 months
BLEND: Add protein powder and liquid when ready to drink
STORAGE: Pre-portioned frozen packs, just add protein and blend
PORTION YOGURT: Divide Greek yogurt into 6 containers
PREP TOPPINGS: Wash berries, portion nuts into small bags
ASSEMBLY: Keep toppings separate until serving
SERVE: Add berries and nuts just before eating
STORAGE: Yogurt keeps 5-7 days, assemble fresh daily
BOIL: Bring water to boil, add eggs, cook 10-12 minutes
ICE BATH: Transfer to ice water to stop cooking
PEEL: Remove shells when completely cool
SEPARATE: Remove yolks for egg white scrambles
STORAGE: Keeps 1 week refrigerated, perfect for quick breakfasts

Serve immediately

Add yogurt to bowl

Add sliced banana on top
Refrigerate overnight (prepare night before)
Reheat in microwave for 90 seconds
